intro: Cryptolobus sarmentosus, commonly known as the creeping cryptolobus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its prostrate growth habit, with slender stems that root at the nodes. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Native to tropical regions of Africa, it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a notable species in the study of tropical flora.
